intro: Hieracium reflorescens, commonly known as the flowering hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its root system consists of fibrous roots that help anchor it in various soil types. Hieracium reflorescens is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed areas, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
